intro: Batschia spicata, commonly known as the spined spurge, is a flowering plant belonging to the Euphorbiaceae family. It is characterized by its distinctive, spiny stems and small, clustered yellow flowers. The plant is native to certain regions of Africa and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are typically alternate and have a rough, waxy texture. Batschia spicata is adapted to survive in harsh conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
